column1: In 36 days the COVID-19 relief bill passed this spring will expire. The clock is ticking to get Americans the help they need and the help they deserve amidst this pandemic.
Action on COVID-19. Childcare. Education. Housing. Health care. Reproductive rights.  This is what we’re voting for. #Vote.

Working together with MN’s Native communities we’ve secured more resources for Native elders’ nutrition services worked on public health challenges uplifted Native leaders’ innovation in urban spaces & secured COVID-19 relief funds. Proud of our partnership.

Whether we’re working to make sure Hmong American farmers are prioritized in the Farm Bill or hearing about the effects of COVID-19 from business owners at Hmong Village I’m grateful to partner with Hmong Americans in MN. Proud to be endorsed by the Peb Hmong American Caucus. https://t.co/BANzQzl1ip

Great to join @UMDCollegeDems @DuluthMPIRG & @MPIRG to hear what’s important to them in this election. From climate change to health care to taking action on COVID-19 there is a lot more work for us to do together. https://t.co/xLmboieo4d

They just said the quiet part out loud: the Trump Administration has given up on controlling the spread of COVID-19.   Americans are dying because of Donald Trump’s incompetence and lack of interest in addressing this crisis. Vote for @JoeBiden. https://t.co/2qfLspmwJz

And yet Donald Trump said just last night about COVID-19 that “it will go away and as I say we're rounding the turn.”  He’s failed to act. And we need action to end this. I’ve got a bipartisan bill to make a comprehensive national testing strategy happen. https://t.co/IxmADKYFJE

As COVID-19 cases continue to rise I want to express my deepest thanks and gratitude for America’s frontline workers — those in medical facilities childcare centers grocery stores and more — who work tirelessly every single day.

We’ve got to make sure everyone has access to affordable health care in rural communities. I have: 💻 Fought to expand telehealth services amid COVID-19 💰 Helped increase funding for rural health clinics 🏥 Helped increase access to rural mental health services
Any COVID-19 vaccine should be free. I’ve got a bill to make it happen.

The COVID-19 pandemic has impacted all of us — especially including Minnesota’s farmers. I fought for farmers in the bipartisan 2018 Farm Bill helped expand funding for rural broadband and fought to strengthen rural health care. https://t.co/7iLAGdZfl5
Update: my COVID test is negative. Headed back to Washington to keep working for Minnesotans. https://t.co/zyiuw7wBfD

I found out this afternoon that a person present at a campaign event last weekend tested positive for COVID-19 today. The event was outdoors & masks were required & while I was never in close contact with them I’m getting tested & I am quarantining until I test negative.

I’ve worked across the aisle to address the COVID-19 pandemic. Writing a bill to end surprise COVID-19 test bills? Doing that. Drafting bipartisan legislation to develop a national testing strategy? Doing that too. But there’s more that needs to be done & I’m prepared to do it.

DeVos has threatened to cut federal funding for schools that didn’t reopen physically in-person due to COVID-19. At a time when schools need significant resources the most she’s prioritized reopening at the expense of safety. https://t.co/3oMyeIKzQL
We need to get COVID-19 under control and one way we can do that is with a national testing strategy. Yet the Trump Admin refuses to take appropriate action. https://t.co/tmf49yWj5F

Providing relief to Americans amidst the COVID-19 pandemic should not be a partisan issue. I’m working with my colleagues across the aisle to address COVID-19 like establishing a national testing strategy.
This pandemic has had a devastating effect on so many Americans. They’re depending on us to come together and pass a bipartisan COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/VI7U5dOkfK

The U.S. Senate should be focused on a COVID-19 relief package not rushing through a Supreme Court nomination. It’s shameful that Republicans have failed to prioritize much-needed relief for months. https://t.co/0iCW4qI8e7

Great to join @AthenaHollins in St. Paul to visit BIPOC-owned businesses & to discuss how COVID-19 has impacted them. I hear your worries — this is your life your business your health. I’m committed to listening & then fighting for you as your advocate in the U.S. Senate. https://t.co/ONIA8vC5wJ

McConnell and Senate Republicans are more interested in rushing a Supreme Court confirmation than passing a COVID-19 relief bill that they’ve stood in the way of for months. It's just flat-out wrong. https://t.co/126warkato

I’m proud to have a strong record of bipartisanship and effectiveness in the U.S. Senate. From expanding rural broadband to securing free diagnostic COVID-19 testing for Americans I’m a U.S. Senator who gets things done. https://t.co/MT3PZWYtxr
Thank you Jill. Telling what having COVID-19 is like in a real and honest way when you have to juggle dealing with an illness and continuing to work. This is worth the read: https://t.co/rtIlibtm8j

Our frontline workers our educators our small business owners our childcare providers our neighbors who have been laid off — these are all people who are waiting for another COVID-19 relief package. Trump is abandoning them at a time when they need help the most.

Americans are still receiving surprise medical bills with their free COVID-19 tests. That’s why I’ve introduced the Stop COVID-19 Test Surprise Medical Bills Act to make sure no one receives an unexpected medical bill for a test.

Today I joined @karlabigham @anne_claflin @reprickhansen @SSP_Super Dave Webb @MattKleinSD52 & Tom Seaberg in South St. Paul to discuss the impacts of COVID-19 on the community. I’m grateful for this community & its leaders who fight for each other amidst these challenges. https://t.co/JbIfkRNY4D

I’m proud to have authored legislation (now law) that provides free diagnostic COVID-19 testing for everybody in this country. Now we need to pass my legislation to make sure we have free vaccines for everyone once that vaccine is safe and available. #mnsen

I go to work for you every day. I’ve been able to pass more than two dozen bills and measures into law to help lower Rx drug costs expand rural broadband support mental health & make COVID-19 tests free for everyone. I work across the aisle because I want to get things done.

Wishing Donald and Melania Trump a full and speedy recovery. An important reminder that no one is immune to COVID-19. Please wear a mask. Practice social distancing. It's on all of us to stop the spread.

.@WestlinSD34 is passionate about making health insurance more accessible and affordable strengthening public schools and responding to inequalities across MN exposed by COVID-19. Proud to endorse her in MN34. https://t.co/2nOrpzck8U

McConnell and Senate Republicans spent months failing to deliver crucial additional COVID-19 relief to Americans.   Now they want to fast track a Supreme Court nomination with just 37 days to Election Day breaking the precedent McConnell set in 2016.  Americans deserve better.

Thanks to the BIPOC community leaders who spoke w/ me @RepWolgamott @TamiForMN and @AricForMN yesterday in Waite Park. COVID-19 hasn’t been the great equalizer. We see in Waite Park & St. Cloud that it’s exacerbated pre-existing inequalities for BIPOC & immigrant communities. https://t.co/8QabCFIBro

We need a national COVID-19 testing strategy. I’ve got a bipartisan bill that empowers states to ramp up testing and contact tracing because we can’t just contain the virus we’ve got to suppress it. https://t.co/zXvTZI1zDu

Broadband is a necessity in every part of life — from connecting communities to education to health. I’ve fought to expand rural broadband led bipartisan efforts to protect rural co-ops & secured funding for telehealth & distance learning in the COVID-19 CARES Act. #mnsen

In February my opponent said he didn’t “oppose anything” Trump had done.   Since February Trump has lied to Americans about COVID-19 damaged our economy and blocked critical support for everyday Americans. #mnsen https://t.co/cx3taEgtI3

I’ve heard from small businesses workers & families across MN who’ve been impacted by COVID-19. Their demands & needs are clear: They need more support. That’s why I’ve fought for increased unemployment benefits funds for small businesses & direct aid for our families. #mnsen

COVID-19 is the biggest public health & economic crisis of our lifetime. And while millions of Americans have contracted the virus my opponent has pushed conspiracy theories and downplayed the seriousness of the virus. #mnsen https://t.co/r2TJv0vgVp https://t.co/ToZvrwro0I

In the Senate I’ve championed legislation that’s helped MN’s families during this crisis:  ✅ Free diagnostic COVID testing & vaccine once available ✅ Expanded unemployment benefits ✅ Direct aid to families ✅ Funding for mental health  #mnsen https://t.co/htHWVdcllH

Minnesotans are looking for more relief amidst this pandemic. I’ve been fighting to simplify the loan forgiveness process for small businesses while McConnell & the GOP have failed to negotiate another COVID-19 relief package spending months confirming judges instead.
COVID-19 has not been the great equalizer. It has disproportionately impacted Black Brown and Indigenous Americans. We’ve got work to solve these health inequities.

COVID-19 has disproportionately affected Tribal communities. They need access to critical HHS & CDC data on infection rates to help tackle this pandemic. This week I intro’d bipartisan legislation that would give Tribal communities the information they need to deal w/ COVID-19.

Donald Trump knew early-on how deadly COVID-19 is. Yet he told the American people otherwise & failed to take prompt & effective action to keep us safe. Trump his Admin & Congressional Republicans are responsible for the inaction in tackling this crisis. https://t.co/79ibjZ6aOB

This #LaborDay I want to especially thank America’s essential workers who are on the frontlines of the fight against COVID-19.   Thank you for helping keep our communities safe. We are grateful for you every day.
As Americans continue to be put at risk it’s taken weeks for some folks to get their COVID-19 test results back. That’s unacceptable. @EWarren and I are seeking answers. https://t.co/6whn7uLbAR

Today is #NationalFoodBankDay. Food banks are a vital resource for Americans struggling with food insecurity even more so amidst the COVID-19 pandemic which has led to millions out of work.  Donate or volunteer for a food bank today. Find one near you: https://t.co/cfUhqBxtKk https://t.co/KGt15tb2c9

.@JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris have a plan to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic and reopen our schools safely. Donald Trump does not. Great to talk with Lt. Gov @PeggyFlanagan and leaders from across MN about this yesterday. https://t.co/w8pefRgDuz

I’m focused on listening to the needs of Minnesotans and taking action to help address the challenges they’re facing amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. Thankful for the opportunity to visit Moorhead the White Earth Nation and Detroit Lakes yesterday to do just that. https://t.co/FdIjpDD8k6

Excited to join my friends Sen. @KamalaHarris and Lt. Gov @PeggyFlanagan for a conversation with Minnesotans about the challenges they are facing with the return to school during the COVID-19 pandemic. RSVP to join us TOMORROW at 2pm CT. ↴ https://t.co/ef1Ynym1wX

A reminder: Pence was appointed to manage the COVID-19 White House task force. Yet more than 180000 Americans have died. This Administration has failed to manage this pandemic. https://t.co/1YYjL3EZcD

Minnesota has some of the most expensive childcare costs in the entire country. @KimforHouseMN and I talked about how we can work to ease this burden for families especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch our full conversation here: https://t.co/6XjE8RmaUr https://t.co/9DTcvfnGX1
Everyone should be able to get a COVID-19 vaccine. I’ve introduced legislation that would make any future vaccine free and widely available to all Americans.

Glad to have visited Big River Farms yesterday. I’ve been working to make sure all Minnesota farmers - old and new - have the support they need. And with the COVID-19 pandemic that has become increasingly more important. https://t.co/7iLAGdZfl5

@lynnellmick @realDonaldTrump Thanks Lynnell. A few things I’ve done: - Urged Senate leadership to provide $ relief in next COVID package - Asked USPS IG to look @ changes w/in & delay in mail - Urged timely delivery of election mail - Demanded USPS Board of Govs to reverse Postmaster Gen's changes

Trump’s campaigning in MN on his “successes.” But let’s look back at just the last 5 months: 5 million+ COVID-19 cases & the worst economy since the Great Depression. But touting failures as achievements isn’t new for Trump. Chip in $3 to help us stop him: https://t.co/8Ensq9Y05i https://t.co/UcMHteJYR0
We’ve got to be doing everything we can to stop the spread of COVID-19. That’s why Rep. @AngieCraigMN and I have introduced a bipartisan bill that would establish a national contact tracing program.

The COVID-19 pandemic has further exacerbated the risk of suicide & mental illness for many Americans. We’ve got to increase access to mental health resources especially during this time. I’ve introduced a bipartisan bill that would do just that. https://t.co/18D3Sn6cbk

Today I spoke with local leaders and educators in Hibbing. COVID-19 has completely reshaped the way we think about schooling. With summer coming to an end our number one priority must be equipping schools with the tools and resources needed to reopen safely. https://t.co/eXDBz8Ieh2

McConnell adjourned the Senate until September with no COVID-19 relief package. Senate Republicans failed to make providing relief to Americans during this crisis a priority unlike House Democrats who passed the HEROES Act in May.

Today I toured Strohfus Hemp Farm in Hastings with Rep. @AngieCraigMN and Sen. @karlabigham. Since the COVID-19 pandemic began farms have been hit especially badly by changes to the supply and production chains. We’ve got to give farms the resources they need to succeed. https://t.co/6dNtFhBlNF

Yesterday I visited El Burrito Mercado La Monarca Supermercado & La Michoacana with Sen. Pappas. Everyone reiterated the impact COVID-19 has had on their business. We’ve got to make sure our small businesses have the resources to reopen safely & thrive. https://t.co/jZY7XIbFSN

Today I joined @SusanKentMN @SteveSandell53b @karlabigham and others to talk about the impact COVID-19 has had on our businesses and schools. There’s much we must do at the local and federal level to keep our communities safe. Thanks to all for joining on Primary Day! https://t.co/yN0kheqmAd

From prioritizing affordable housing to guiding small businesses through the COVID-19 pandemic Mayor @LarsonForDuluth has been a champion for the people of Duluth. I’m honored to call her a friend and to have her support. (& this photo is from 2018!) https://t.co/AxQOyELUvV

I’m working with @EWarren to make sure funding for child care providers is a top priority in our COVID-19 relief efforts. Parents need safe affordable & reliable access to child care and providers need resources to make that happen.

Every Minnesotan should have access to affordable & accessible health care. I’ve fought for:  🩺 Telehealth service expansions amid COVID-19 🏩 Increased funding for rural health clinics 🧠 Increased mental health services in rural MN  #FarmfestDebate #MNFarmfest

A record of effectiveness matters. I’m proud of my accomplishments in the U.S. Senate like passing legislation to lower the cost of insulin protect rural electric co-ops & prevent vital drug shortages during COVID-19. #FarmfestDebate #MNFarmfest https://t.co/MT3PZWYtxr

COVID-19 has had a profound impact on Minnesota families and agriculture. I helped secure $24 billion in aid for American farmers and producers in federal COVID-19 relief packages including up to $16 billion in direct payments to farmers and ranchers. #FarmfestDebate #MNFarmfest

Every day that the Senate doesn’t pass a COVID-19 stimulus package is a day we’re hurting millions of Americans. Mitch McConnell should’ve followed the lead of House Democrats and acted months ago. https://t.co/GiAXSn2ZoR

Maybe Senate Republicans should’ve spent more time negotiating a COVID-19 relief package than confirming judges. 🤔   We’ve got to get Americans the support they need during this time. Now. https://t.co/G0zGkboq4f

The first confirmed case of COVID-19 in the U.S. was in January. It’s now August 7 months later and the Trump Administration still doesn’t have a comprehensive national testing strategy. Our president and his administration are tragically incompetent.

Masks are one of the most effective tools we have in slowing the spread of COVID-19. Every American should have access to a high-quality reusable face mask. Proud to have joined @BernieSanders in helping introduce the Masks for All Act.

Mitch McConnell failed to take action for months on a new COVID-19 relief package. Meanwhile House Democrats passed their bill 10 weeks ago. Americans are gripped by uncertainty and worry over the impact of COVID-19. My CNN op-ed ↴ https://t.co/6FwnI0VPLK

Democrats rolled out their COVID-19 relief package AND passed it in the House months ago. Meanwhile Republicans have failed to take action while relief programs from the CARES Act have begun to expire. That’s incompetence. https://t.co/ve61zDjr4S
Without an increase in funding child care providers risk being further destabilized by the impact of COVID-19. @EWarren and I have a plan to do just that. https://t.co/YXmYTy41KV

We’ve got to give schools the resources they need to #ReopenSafely and to help ensure that no student receives a worse education because of COVID-19’s impact on their community. @BetsyDeVosED it’s well overdue to make this a priority.

I recently introduced a bipartisan bill that would amend Small Business Administration (SBA) rules so rural hospitals can take advantage of the Paycheck Protection Program. More than ever due to COVID-19 we’ve got to support hospitals serving rural communities.

Yesterday I joined a letter to VP Mike Pence asking him to outline what his Task Force plans to do to address the long-term health effects of COVID-19. Even as Trump claims it’s “totally harmless” many Americans are still feeling symptoms weeks after recovery. We need to act.

It’s been 69 days since the House passed major COVID-19 relief measures in the HEROES Act. We can’t keep stalling to get something passed in the Senate. We’ve got to pass the HEROES Act now so Americans get relief immediately.

A statewide mask mandate could make a significant difference in stopping the spread of COVID-19. I’m thankful for the leadership of @GovTimWalz on this issue. Visit https://t.co/uSCb3qn06n for more information. Here are the basics: https://t.co/sGTIciyTrr

I recently helped introduce the Coronavirus Child Care and Education Relief Act alongside Sen. @MurrayCampaign. This bill would put $430 billion towards stabilizing child care providing relief for schools addressing child abuse and neglect and much more.
In the same year that millions of Americans will rely on the USPS to vote due to COVID-19 the Trump Administration wants to destabilize it. Coincidence? We need to #SaveUSPS. https://t.co/pzR8giFJFw

We recently hit over 76000 COVID-19 cases a day. Yet Donald Trump still isn’t taking this pandemic seriously. How is blocking funding for testing tracing and the CDC effective in any way? https://t.co/oRPXFGov5I

As I return to Washington I’m taking these stories with me to guide my work helping on the next round of COVID-19 relief. I’m committed to helping ensure that Minnesotans get the economic and health support they need during the pandemic.

I’m working to ensure that small businesses that didn’t receive economic aid in the first round of COVID-19 relief will see expansive funding in the next round. I’m thankful for my talks with businesses and leaders in Montgomery Waseca and Mankato. https://t.co/8czKCj5j2B

Hey Team Tina! Are you passionate about a specific issue? Our team is hosting short daily virtual water cooler chats on a wide range of topics - from COVID-19 & college affordability to climate justice & income inequality. Sign-up to join ↴ https://t.co/enmYShSHX3

It was a pleasure to join @BradTabke and Sahra Odowa as we toured Downtown Shakopee today. Small business owners have been hit particularly hard by COVID-19 and I was humbled to be able to speak with them hear their stories and talk about the work that we need to do. https://t.co/URanBYQT2E

32% of Americans missed housing payments in July. The lack of affordable housing has been exacerbated by the economic fallout of COVID-19. I’m working to get renters protection and expand affordable housing projects in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/yd6Fq4KEWi

Yesterday I joined Sen. @founghawj & Rep. @KaohlyVangHer to visit the Sun Ray Shopping Center in St. Paul. Small businesses in this community have been hit especially hard by COVID-19 and recent city-wide riots. We need to ensure they have the resources to come back stronger. https://t.co/7Mvo1NRzlJ

I joined Sen. @BobMenendezNJ and my colleagues in calling for increased public transit funding in the next COVID-19 stimulus package. Public transit is essential for millions of Americans. We need to make sure these systems have the resources they need to serve our communities.
This is truly a crisis within a crisis. COVID-19 has further exposed the racial disparities that plague the United States. We must do better. https://t.co/z5NMKr0Zn7

Last week I signed a letter to AG Barr expressing concern about the closures of polling locations in tribal communities due to COVID-19. Indigenous communities must have proper access to the ballot box.
As COVID-19 cases continue to rise across the country health care workers on the frontlines still lack proper access to PPE. The Trump Administration needs to make this a top priority.
This is systemic racism. Black and Brown Americans already faced large housing disparities because of their race & income. COVID-19 is only exacerbating these issues. https://t.co/1UbCso6hpe

The #FourthOfJuly parades on the Iron Range are some of my favorite events of the year. While I’m sad I can’t celebrate with the community this year due to COVID-19 I am wishing all Minnesotans a fun and safe holiday weekend! 🎆 https://t.co/fiTS0d3aDv

Coronavirus cases are rising across a majority of states. Yet Trump wants to host a big event with no social distancing for the Fourth of July. When will he put American lives first?  https://t.co/LPookG4BtX

.@EWarren is right. COVID-19 is taking a toll on childcare providers and we’ve got to act now to stop it from further impacting our economy. We have a plan to do just that. I’m glad to be in this fight together. https://t.co/6FKCDijr2j

Even in these unprecedented times for our economy I’m proud of Minnesotans for stepping up to the cause and taking care of one another. So many have been harmed financially due to COVID-19. We need a strong and diverse economy for ALL Minnesotans. https://t.co/RJ4xh6zVDH

Thanks to Steven and Jodi Read of @shepswayfarms for giving @AngieCraigMN and me a tour of your wonderful sheep dairy farm. Farms of all sizes have been impacted by COVID-19. Now more than ever we must support our farmers and help grow our rural economies. https://t.co/Kv98iwzAJ7

As COVID-19 continues to ravage the economy and leave Minnesotans vulnerable to food insecurity we’ve got to make sure that food is widely available and accessible to everyone regardless of income. https://t.co/zGl3wZ7Q4f
Every single one of us is at risk of contracting COVID-19. We’ve got to do our part and help keep each other safe. https://t.co/naDbJryOua

Thankful for the opportunity to talk to @MinnesotaDFL-ers Lt. Gov @PeggyFlanagan and Tribal and urban Indian leaders about the disproportionate impact COVID-19 is having on their communities. We have to do more to keep our tribes safe. https://t.co/TAp1EfBwEL
COVID-19 infection rates are increasing across the country. Millions of Americans are still unemployed. And what is Mitch McConnell worried about today? Confirming judges.
Dr. Fauci is right: COVID-19 is still a major risk to our communities. Keep wearing masks. Keep social distancing. And get tested if you’re experiencing symptoms.  https://t.co/C1Pfg2jaAT

Join me @MinnesotaDFL and Tribal leaders from across the state on Wednesday for a discussion about the disproportionate impacts of COVID-19 on our Tribal and urban Indian communities.  RSVP here: https://t.co/hT2EMJ8f5E

Since the pandemic began the Asian American and Pacific Islander community has faced an increase in discrimination and attacks. It’s shameful that our leaders would perpetuate hate by creating racist nicknames for COVID-19.

It was an honor to speak w/ faith leaders at Greater Friendship Missionary Baptist Church. COVID has dangerously exacerbated existing racial disparities & we’ve got to restore opportunities to our Black & Brown communities. Thanks for your insight & kindness Rev Billy Russell. https://t.co/VK0tOHT4s5

George Floyd’s death was one of many events that revealed racial injustices and inequalities in our society. These injustices extend beyond police brutality. They exist in our schools too. We cannot let COVID-19 deepen inequalities. https://t.co/Pz6sudc3Wn
Archie and I are amazed and delighted and even though because of COVID we can’t hold him in our arms we are already planning grandparent treats.

Join me @MinnesotaDFL @LtGovFlanagan and Tribal leaders from across the state on June 24 for a discussion of the disproportionate impacts of COVID-19 on our tribal and urban Indian communities.  Sign-up here: https://t.co/hT2EMJ8f5E

I’m joining my fellow Senators in calling on FEMA to provide Tribal governments with guidance on disaster relief resources and how to receive support. Tribes have been hit hard by COVID-19. We must fulfill our responsibility to help.

As our community continues to suffer though the COVID-19 crisis that has disproportionately affected communities of color we need to face up to the disparities in opportunity that hurt black brown and indigenous people every day and we need to use this moment to take action.

My heart breaks for the families of those who have died from coronavirus. Nothing we say or do can ease the pain of these devastating losses but I am committed to making our communities healthier & stronger as we fight through this. https://t.co/dRoY3XtQkI
We need to be prepared for a potential second outbreak of coronavirus in the fall. We must learn from experience and work even harder to keep our communities healthy and safe. https://t.co/bq6H1skpcK

Right now we must make sure families can stay in their homes & are able to pay their bills. If you don’t have a safe place to live nothing else in your life works. Families are hurting. We need to address this in the next coronavirus package. https://t.co/gWLeFsfISs

In MN telehealth visits increased from about 1K/day before COVID-19 to up to 15K/day in late April. I introduced a bill to increase funding for telehealth services & ensure providers are getting reimbursed by insurance companies for these visits. https://t.co/UtWjEXhuQ7

Today @ewarren and I are introducing the COVID-19 Testing Inventory Act. Right now there’s a lack of transparency when it comes to how many coronavirus tests we have & how to get access to tests. We can only fight this pandemic if we have the data we need. This is urgent.
I am fighting hard to make sure the @USPS receives emergency relief in the next coronavirus relief package. There’s too much at stake.
Without sufficient support Minnesota could lose 55% of its childcare services. We must prioritize funding for our childcare system in the next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/NMZT7e2Aaj

We need to pass the All Dependents Count Act. No one should be getting left out of our coronavirus relief efforts. Families w/ dependents over 16 adults w/ disabilities & college students need aid too.

We must ensure that every community has the resources they need to fight this pandemic. That’s why I signed a letter asking the Trump administration to form a rural COVID-19 task force. https://t.co/ti3hMIzHZK

Last night the Senate passed another coronavirus relief package that included funding for our hospitals testing & small business loans. There is still a lot of work to be done. I won’t stop listening to your needs & advocating for you at every level.

Widespread & reliable COVID-19 testing is essential. @Mike_Pence the Coronavirus Task Force & @FEMA need to start a national inventory for testing supplies & develop a plan to address supply shortages. https://t.co/wEtDjJHT9a

It is so important that no one gets left out of our coronavirus relief efforts. That’s why I am fighting to make sure families with dependents over 16 adults with disabilities and college students get the help they need. https://t.co/nTXrdD0Nyp

I worked hard to make sure the coronavirus relief package included legislation to prevent drug shortages during this public health crisis. It’s critical doctors have the resources they need to treat those in their care. https://t.co/EUtUkTSWpJ

The coronavirus stimulus package doesn’t include payments for families w/ dependents that include children over 16 college students & adults with disabilities. I introduced the All Dependents Count Act to right this wrong & provide much-needed relief. https://t.co/gXYILlNVmF

Minnesota farmers help produce our nation’s food supply — & our rural communities need support during this crisis. That’s why I’m proud to stand with @AmyKlobuchar to demand relief to farmers as the effects of coronavirus change our daily lives. https://t.co/4A65JsHLcb
The president needs to stop treating coronavirus like a PR war and start treating it like the public health crisis that it is. https://t.co/HKxzu3sgXc

Last night the Senate passed a bipartisan coronavirus bill — offering some much-needed relief to American families small businesses hospitals and local and state governments. This is just the first step. But know this: I’m not done fighting for you.
To my sister @peggyflanagan Archie and I are so sorry that you’ve lost your brother Ron to coronavirus. Sending support and strength to you and everyone struggling with this terrible disease today.

This week we made progress on the federal response to COVID-19. But here’s what I’m still pushing for: -Help our hospitals & health care systems prepare & respond -MORE testing -Put money into the hands of so many who’ve lost their livelihoods overnight -Support small businesses https://t.co/7bDG16Z89r
